intro: Desmos palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan desmos, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines, specifically Palawan Island. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub structure with simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, and it bears small, round fruits that are edible. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
